message:
docs: Add comprehensive upstream plans for EMLX and Bumblebee

Two new documents addressing Paulo Valente's feedback from EMLX PR #95:

emlx-quantization-plan.md:
- Transparent quantized tensors via EMLX.QuantizedTensor struct
- Smart Nx.dot override to detect and dispatch quantized operands
- Comprehensive test plan for quantized tensor operations
- Migration path from current EMLX-specific to Nx-transparent API

FULL_UPSTREAM_PLAN.md:
- Complete 3-month upstream strategy across EMLX, Safetensors, Bumblebee
- Stream 1: EMLX foundation (QuantizedTensor, smart Nx.dot)
- Stream 2: Safetensors dependency check
- Stream 3: Bumblebee integration (quantized loading, LoRA adapters)
- Stream 4: Training integration (mlx_lm wrapper)
- Test matrix, success criteria, risk mitigation

Key insight: Don't expose EMLX.quantized_matmul directly. Make Nx.dot
smart enough to detect quantized tensors and dispatch automatically.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

docs: Flesh out decision graph for Bumblebee contribution

Added 51 new nodes capturing:
- 3 key decisions (backend strategy, model definition, LoRA scope)
- 9 options for those decisions with rationale
- 25 observations about implementation details
- 5-step upstream contribution plan
- API design decisions for loader and adapters
- Technical details (LoRA scaling, weight format, KV cache)
- User workflow and performance expectations

Graph now: 213 nodes, 235 edges

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

docs: Add blog post and upstream PR plan

- BLOG_POST.md: Comprehensive writeup of the pure Elixir journey

Tracked in deciduous as nodes 35-39.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

feat: Pure Elixir LoRA inference - no Python

Major changes:
- Switch from fused model to runtime LoRA for better quality
  - Fused model re-quantizes after merge, losing precision
  - Runtime LoRA keeps adapters in fp32, preserving fine-tuning
- Replace Python subprocess tokenization with Bumblebee tokenizer
  - New BobbyPosts.Tokenizer module using Bumblebee.load_tokenizer
  - Pure Elixir encode/decode via Tokenizers library
- Add /no_think directive to disable Qwen3 chain-of-thought
- Strip emojis and hashtags from generated posts
- Clean up response extraction for Bumblebee's token format

The LoRA formula (attention.ex:179-193):
  base_output = quantized_matmul(x, weights)  # 4-bit GPU
  lora_output = (x @ lora_a @ lora_b) * scale # fp32 precise
  return base_output + lora_output

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: YOUR_NAME_HERE
message:
fix: Add temperature sampling to eliminate deterministic cat posts

- Fixed tokenization to use temp files instead of string interpolation
  which was causing newlines to be escaped incorrectly
- Added temperature-based sampling with top-p filtering
- Default temperature=0.7, top_p=0.9 matches mlx-lm behavior
- Greedy decoding (temperature=0) deterministically produces cat posts
- Sampling produces varied output matching the training data distribution

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
